The trial and lack of conviction of Dr: William Waddell following a failed abortion where the fetus initially survived.
The historical context of the events: which took place in 1977 when abortion was legal throughout the country during all nine months of pregnancy.
The use of saline abortions in the 1970s: 80s, their dangers to the mother and the possibility of live births.
The lack of recent information or eviden: as the events described occurred in 1977 and were not a current event.
